page.title: 07Transport & services
page.content: The school children go out of the area either on the school bus or with parents, so they rely on their bikes or parents to get to youth groups like scouts or guides, and to discos or lake pursuits in Windemere or Kendal. There are no facilities except the local public house the Brown Horse, which is quite large and does a good trade. Most homes have a television and the reception is moderate to good, depending on access through hills to the booster. There are events in the village hall. Practically every remote home has a dog and hound dogs are also housed and walked until mature enough for the local hunts.
